Description: 30 beads of different shapes and materials. A: One flattened sphere bead made of blue glass with white lines. B: Bead made of turquoise glaze in the shape of a flat flower cone. The base is flat, almost all edges are chipped of. C: Cylindrical bead with rounded edges, made of light green faience. D: Flattened spherical bead made of light green faience. E: Two ring beads made of white faience. F: One bead made of white stone in a biconical shape, one end partly broken off. G: Five beads in a disc shape with circumferential notches along the outer face, made of light green faience. Two of them glued together. H: One small cylindrical segmented bead made of white faience, three segments preserved. I: Small biconical bead made of red jasper. J: Five disc-shaped beads made of ostrich eggshell and one made of shell. K: 12 disc-shaped beads made of faience in different colours from white and yellow to blue and turquoise.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
